"I see magic," she says simply. "The real kind of magic. The kind that weaves itself into people. And you..." Her eyes narrow just slightly, like she's watching something take shape behind your skin. "You're wrapped in it. Not cursed, not really. Just... waking up."

You freeze.

Aurora isn't guessing. She knows.

Your voice feels small in your throat. "What am I supposed to do?"

Aurora studies you for a long moment, like she's weighing how much to say. Then a slow, almost sad smile tugs at the corner of her mouth. She's not pitying you, but she does know something.

"When you're ready to stop fighting it, come find me," she says, her voice softer now. "I can help you understand what this really is. But be careful. The longer you resist, the harder it'll be to hear what your heart's been trying to tell you."

She steps back, the sunlight glinting off the silver on her wrists. She turns, and by the time your eyes follow, she's already slipping into the passing tide of students. One blink, and she's gone—no trace, no silhouette.

You're left standing there, not quite knowing what to think. Maybe you would take her up on her offer and seek her out later, but for now, you had to get to class.

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 4 - Jeans
passages.text:
You panic, hyperventilating a little as you try and calm yourself. Fuck, you just transformed at the mall. This was the first time you transformed at such a public place, and you were scared. 
 
 You remember that you have told your friends about the curse, so at least that part is covered. You step out of the changing room, glad you told your friends about the curse already.

 "Woah, [name], what the hell?" Samantha asks, looking at you closely. "Did the curse hit you again?"

 "Yup, I don't want to talk about it," you shake your head. "Just try changing into your clothes, Samantha."

 "Just let us know if you need support, okay?" Luke says, concern evident in his voice.

 
 You remember that you haven't told your friends about the curse, so you'll have to explain that too. You bury your face in your hands, not knowing how to approach this. You decide to come out clean about the curse, not knowing how else you would approach this. If you were lucky, Luke might not notice, but Samantha certainly would. You step out of the changing room, heart pounding.

 "Woah, [name], what the hell?" Samantha asks, looking at you closely.

 "Look, I can explain," you say, leading your two friends into a quiet corner. You explain everything about Madame Serena, the changes to your eyes, the tingling, and more. It takes a bit of convincing, but considering the evidence is right in front of them, they eventually believe you. "I don't want to talk about it further, let's just continue like nothing happened.

 "Just let us know if you need support, okay?" Luke says, concern evident in his voice.
 

[Choice: Rate Samantha's outfits]

passages.name: Day 4 - Restroom
passages.text:
You splash some water on your face, trying to ignore what just happened. You just transformed from piercing your ears, what the hell? You suppose you should've anticipated that though; pierced ears were still kind of seen as feminine, even if many men got their ears pierced too nowadays. You wonder if your appearance has changed too drastically, you try and recount how many times you've transformed and get the number [femineChanges]. Suddenly, you hear someone cough as they walk into the restroom.

<<if [feminineLooks] > 19>> 
 "Oh shit, am I in the wrong restroom?" the guy jumps a little as he sees you, quickly stepping back outside and checking the restroom sign. "Oh, never mind, my bad. I thought you were a girl for a second."

 Well, here's your answer. You've definitely changed enough to be perceived as a feminine guy now. You suppose that guy didn't have the best eyes, considering you didn't look quite androgynous or female yet, but you definitely didn't look like a normal guy anymore. 

 
 "What's up man?" the guy asks, giving you a classic guy nod as he walks past you into a stall.

 Well, here's your answer. You haven't changed enough to be perceived as a feminine guy yet. You still look like a normal guy for now.
 

You walk out of the restroom to see your friends right outside waiting for you.

 
 "[name], are you alright?" Samantha inquires, clearly worried about you.

 "Yeah, I'm fine, just a little worried about these changes."

 "Did the curse activate because you pierced your ears?" Luke asks, putting his hand on your shoulder. 

 "I think so, yeah," you say. "Let's just keep going and discuss this another time though."

 "I'll respect that, but we are going to have to talk about this at some point, okay?" Samantha demands.

 
 
 "Are you alright, did you vomit?" Luke asks, frowning.

 "Yeah, it was really nasty," you tremble to really sell the lie that you threw up.

 "Don't fucking lie to us, [name]," Samantha puts her hands on her hips. "You've been acting weird and you even look different, there's something going on."

 "Ugh, you're too observant, Samantha," you sigh and start explaining the curse. Your friends believe you, and you feel a weight lifted off your shoulders. "Let's just keep going and discuss this another time though."

 "I'll respect that, but we are going to have to talk about this at some point, okay?" Samantha demands.
 

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 5 - 1
passages.text:
You stretch and hop out of bed, ready for what Friday has to offer. Today would include the back-to-school party, and you knew just how much that meant. It was the first social event of the year, and you knew that how you acted today would be very important. After you get ready, you exit your room and go to the living room. Lily sits on the couch browsing her phone, taking a quick glance at you.

<<if [feminineLooks] > 19>> 
 "Why do you look like that, [name]?" she asks, frowning. "You actually look kind of pretty, too bad your personality ruins it."

 "Just experimenting with how I look a little," you say, nervous that you changed enough that your mom and sister pointed out your new look. "Why, do you need any tips?"

 "Hey, I don't need t-" you close the front door on Lily as she shrieks, clearly annoyed by your comment. You can't help but laugh, it was fun being the mean older brother.

 
 "Hey, loser," she laughs. "Did you get in trouble after staying out too late yesterday?"

 "None of your business," you say, walking past her and putting your hand on the door. Despite the curse, you do your best to act the same as always to Lily. "At least I have friends to hang out with."

 "Hey, I have more f-" you close the front door on Lily as she shrieks, clearly annoyed by your comment. You can't help but laugh, it was fun being the mean older brother.
 

[Choice: Go to school]

passages.name: Day 5 - 10
passages.text:
"I think you should sing the classic one," you exclaim, excited to see what Samantha thought was a classic.

 "What's more of a classic than Katy Perry?" Samantha beams. "I'll sing Teenage Dream since this is one of the last years we have as teenagers."

 You think about if Teenage Dream is a classic or not, and realize the song was a teenager now that it was 2024. You suppose it does count as a classic.

 "Go for it, I'm sure you'll do well," you say, trying your best to support Samantha.

 "Yeah, I'm going to knock their socks off," Samantha smirks.

 You and Samantha wait as the girl finishes up her song, and Samantha immediately takes her spot. She searches Teenage Dream on the karaoke machine controller and the lyrics pop up on the screen. A few seconds later, the instrumentals begin to play and Samantha shifts her weight from foot to foot as she prepares for the song. She looks back at you and winks before the song starts, and launches into the song immediately. She does a really good job at imitating Katy Perry's iconic voice and matches the retro elements of the song. She finishes up the song and everyone claps.

 
 "Hmm, I think you should sing the trending song," you exclaim, thinking it's better to sing something new.

 "Hmm, let me sing Espresso, it was the song of the summer after all!" Samantha beams. "It's sad that summer is over already though."

 "Well, time flies, what can you do," you shrug. "Anyway, go sing, I'm sure you'll do well."

 "Yeah, I'm going to knock their socks off," Samantha smirks.

 You and Samantha wait as the girl finishes up her song, and Samantha immediately takes her spot. She searches for Espresso on the karaoke machine controller and the lyrics pop up on the screen. A few seconds later, the instrumentals begin to play and Samantha shifts her weight from foot to foot as she prepares for the song. She looks back at you and winks before the song starts, and launches into the song immediately. She does a really good job at imitating Sabrina Carpenter's sultry voice and matches the synth elements of the song. She finishes up the song and everyone claps.
 

"Whoo, I did good!" Samantha enthuses, pumping her fist as she sees what score the karaoke machine will give her. The number on the screen flashes and flickers until it finally lands on 93. "Damn, look at that! Pretty good, if I do say so myself."

"Good fucking job!" you high-five Samantha, excited for her.

"You know, [name], it would be really cool if you sang something," Samantha says with an evil grin. "I think you'd do a good job!"

[Choice: Decide to sing]
[Choice: Decide not to sing]

passages.name: Day 5 - 11
passages.text:
"Nah, I don't think I'm going to sing today," you shake your head. "Maybe another time."

 "Aww, really?" Samantha asks, seeming disappointed. "Well, your choice I guess."

 
You and Samantha head back to the main party, and you look around to see what you should do. "What else should we do?"

"I don't know, we can't get Luke for a little longer, so we should just do one of the activities," Samantha says. "How about we go the wheel?"

"The wheel?" you ask, face scrunching up in confusion. That sounded strangely ominous, what the hell was the wheel?

"It's nothing weird, it's just that every student gets to spin a wheel once for a prize," Samantha explains, waving off your shock. "Most of the rewards are super shitty like a sticker or something, but you can win something good like a free snack voucher, homework pass, or free school merch."

"Let's go then, I hope I win something good," you exclaim, walking over to the wheel with Samantha. You have to wait in line for a minute or two, but soon you're at the front. 

"Hello, please present your student ID and then spin the wheel," the girl who's attending to the wheel says. You hand over your student ID, and the girl checks a box beside your name on a sheet she has. "Okay, you can spin the wheel."

You put your hand on the wheel and get ready to spin it, deciding to put a certain amount of force into the spin.

[Choice: Put in a little bit of force]
[Choice: Put in a moderate amount of force]
[Choice: Put in a lot of force]

choices.text: Put in a little bit of force
Put in a moderate amount of force
Put in a lot of force

passages.name: Day 5 - 12
passages.text:
You only put a little bit of force into the wheel, giving it a gentle spin. It turns slowly, clicking from section to section, and finally creeps toward its stopping point. 
 
 "Ooh, congrats!" the girl manning the wheel says, handing you a ticket. "You won a month of a free gym membership! This is the best prize we have."

 "Damn, you can get jacked, [name]!" Samantha slaps you on the back affectionately. 

 "Guess I've got to start working out now," you say, a grin on your face. Although a gym membership wasn't exactly what you were looking for, winning a prize felt good.

 
 You put a moderate amount of force on the wheel, and it spins at a steady pace, clicking through the sections a few times. Eventually, though, it starts to slow down, and it finally clicks to a stop. You end up winning a school hoodie, which you see as a pretty decent prize. It says Pacific Crest High School across the front and has the school mascot, a panther, looking ferocious. 

 "Not bad," Samantha says, whistling as you're handed the hoodie.

 "I guess this is decent," you shrug.

 
 You put all your strength into the spin, and the wheel whirls wildly. It spins for a long time, and the tension builds as you watch nervously. Finally, it begins to slow, clicking to a stop. Despite all the tension, you end up winning a school spirit wristband, one of the worst prizes you could get. The girl attending the stand congratulates you and drops the wristband into your hand. 

 "Nice prize, [name]," Samantha laughs at your disappointed expression.

 "What did I put that much effort in for?" you ask, letting out a defeated sigh.
 

"Move aside, it is my turn now," Samantha announces, handing over her student ID and spinning the wheel. She puts so much force into it that the wheel, which was probably made in a few minutes, almost topples over. 

"You won a keychain," the girl tells Samantha, much to her chagrin.

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 5 - 13
passages.text:
You head over to the snack table with Samantha, which is filled with chips, cookies, pizza, soda, and punch. You notice a lot of the good snacks are already gone, not to mention the pizza is all stale and cold.

"Hey, I'm going to head to the restroom real quick, okay?" Samantha says after she takes a sip of soda. "Just wait here for me."

"Yeah, sure," you reply, watching as Samantha scurries off toward the restroom. You eat some pretzels and chips when you notice some people you recognize around you. Jessica stands by the snack table with casual confidence, sipping on some punch by herself. Vincent is standing off to the side, carefully analyzing the variety of snacks. You see Aurora standing away from the main table, sipping a dark-colored drink that you're pretty sure she brought. Finally, Jordan stands by the drinks, his muscular frame making him hard to miss.

[Choice: Go talk to Jessica]
[Choice: Go talk to Vincent]
[Choice: Go talk to Aurora]
[Choice: Go talk to Jordan]

passages.name: Day 5 - 14
passages.text:
"Hey, Jessica," you say approaching her nervously. You're scared that she'll ignore you or be mad that you're talking to her due to the difference in popularity between you two. 

 "Oh, homeroom partner!" she greets you. "What's up?"

 "I just wanted to say your outfit is really awesome, you pull it off well," you enthuse.

 "Oh, thanks!" Jessica smiles. She looks down at her perfectly fitted green dress. "I can't show up looking raggedy to the first social event of the year, can I?"

 "No, you can't," you chuckle. "I'm surprised you didn't tell me to go away."

 "Look, I'm really not that mean," Jessica rubs the bridge of her nose. "A lot of people spread rumors about me, so I think you have the wrong idea of who I am."

 "I know you're not mean, we are homeroom partners after all," you stick your hand out.

 "Yup, you're stuck with me all year," Jessica says, shaking your hand.

 
 
 "How's it going, Vincent?" you ask as you approach him. You realize he's dressed in a faded graphic tee with a sci-fi design on it, you can't help but be endeared by his commitment to his nerdy interests.

 "Oh, hey [name]!" Vincent says, enthused to see you. "It's nice to finally see someone I know here."

 "Why, have you been alone this whole time?" you ask, tilting your head.

 "Yeah, I don't even know why I decided to come," Vincent says softly, looking down at the floor. "But whatever, I'll just enjoy the free snacks and then go home soon."

 "Well, what would you say the best snack here is?" you ask, trying to appeal to his interests. "What's better, the cookies or the chips?"

 "Well, the cookies have more immediate energy since they have a lot of sugar," Vincent launches into an explanation. "But chips provide longer-lasting energy from the fat and carbohydrates. They're both really good, just for different things."

 "So I should grab both?" you ask playfully.

 "Well, if you're going to stay here for the rest of the party, maybe a combination is the way to go," Vincent says, a smile on his face. "Got to keep the energy levels up, right?"

 
 
 "Hey, Aurora," you can't help but shiver as you approach the mysterious girl. "What are you drinking? It doesn't look like any drink that's offered here."

 "Oh, this?" she asks, smirking and holding up the black drink. "It's just soda."

 "Hmm, okay," you say, the skepticism obvious in your tone. "Can I ask about what you said to me in the hallway?"

 "Shh," Aurora shushes you, putting a finger to your lips with a cheeky smile on her face. "Not in the middle of a party."

 "Oh, sure," you murmur, instantly feeling embarrassed even as she takes her finger off your lips. "Is there anywhere I can find you? You don't have any socials."

 "You'll find me when you need to," Aurora takes another sip of her drink. "Don't worry."

 
 
 "Jordan, how are you?" you ask, walking toward him. You see Jordan sipping on a bottle of water with an unreadable expression on his face. Despite the fact that he's on the football team, he's not with the rest of the team. "You're looking like you're in top shape, do you train daily?"

 "Yeah, every day," he says, a bit of irritation evident in his gruff voice. "Some people slack off, but I don't."

 "Oh, I see," you struggle to find what to say next. "Do you have any tips for me? I'm trying to stay fit myself."

 "If you're serious about it, you can't make excuses," Jordan explains. "I don't waste time giving advice to people who aren't willing to push themselves."

 "Look, I think we got off on the wrong foot," you say, trying to exude cold confidence like Jordan does so effortlessly. "I'm willing to put in the effort and I won't give up so easily."

 "Hmm," Jordan says, his eyes flickering in surprise. "You know what, fine. I like your guts, so I'll give you some advice. Make sure you push yourself but don't do it for others. That type of motivation won't last. Remember first and foremost it's about you."
 

You spot the gym door swinging open and Samantha steps into the party, looking around for you.

"Oh, I have to go now," you quickly wave goodbye and make your way to Samantha.

"Hey, [name]," Samantha greets you. "Come on, let's get Luke now."

[Choice: Go take back Luke]

passages.name: Day 5 - 15
passages.text:
"Hello football players!" Samantha says, approaching the entire football team with an unmatched confidence. "[name] and I have come back to take back our beloved Puke, thank you!"

"Oh, yeah," Luke chuckles as the entire football team looks at him. "I promised my friends that I'd hang out with them at this party."

<<if [popularity] > 39>> 
 "You're going to ditch us for Samantha and this random guy?" one of the football players asks.

 
 "You're going to ditch us for Samantha and this loser?" one of the football players asks.
 

"Hey, [name] is my friend, don't fucking act like that," Luke snarls, getting all up in the other guys face. "Look, I've been hanging out with you guys for this entire party, I'm going to hang out with my closest friends now."

"Damn, Luke," Samantha giggles at Luke's display he just put on. "So you can be scary when you feel like it."

"Yeah, yeah," Luke says as the three of you walk away from the football team. 

[Choice: Thank Luke for defending you]
[Choice: Don't thank Luke for defending you]

choices.text: Don't thank Luke for defending you

passages.name: Day 5 - 16
passages.text:
"Oh, thanks for defending me by the way," you say as Luke leads you and Samantha to the main party. "I appreciate it."

 "Of course," Luke says, a bright smile on his face. "What, do you think I would just let them insult you?"
 
 "Well, it was still nice of you," you reply. "Thank you."

 
 You stay silent as Luke leads you and Samantha back to the main party.
 

"Ooh, we should go check out the face paint station!" Samantha chirps as she spots a boy with a basketball painted on his cheek. "We can get designs painted on us."

"I'm up for that," Luke nods. "I wonder what design I should get."

"Hey, what can I do for you?" asks Rachel, a girl that you recognize, at the face paint station. "We've got all sorts of designs! I can do something subtle or something a bit bolder, all up to you."

"I'll just go with some eye black," Luke takes a seat at the station and moves his face toward Rachel.

"Isn't that a bit boring though?" Samantha asks, tilting her head. "How about Rachel paints your face white?"

"Why would I paint my face white?" Luke frowns.

"Then she can add some red on your nose, and some blue around your eyes," Samantha breaks into a smirk and giggles.

"I am not a clown," Luke sighs, realizing what Samantha was implying. "Just two black lines under my eyes if you may, Rachel. Ignore Samantha."

"I think Samantha's idea is better, but sure," the girl gets some black paint and makes two quick lines under Luke's eyes. "There you go!"

"Thanks," Luke says as he stands up. He looks significantly more threatening and athletic than he did just a minute ago. "How do I look?"

"Are you sure you don't want to get some red paint on your nose?" Samantha sighs, acting disappointed.

"I'm positive," Luke replies.

"Well, I want a rainbow on my cheek," Samantha says, taking the seat in front of Rachel. Rachel works quickly and a few seconds later, Samantha is looking fancy. "This washes off, right?"

"Yes, don't worry, it'll come off when you're wiping off your makeup," Rachel says. "Okay, how about you, [name]?"

"Huh, me?" you ask, snapping back to reality. "Umm, I'm not sure."

"Come on, you should get one," Luke tries convincing you.

"We have some popular designs over here, take a look," Rachel says, showing you a laminated piece of paper with a bunch of designs. A few stick out to you, and you decide on what you should get.

[Choice: Decide not to get your face painted]
[Choice: Get a small star on your cheek]
[Choice: Get a tiny flower on your forehead]
[Choice: Get a tribal symbol under your eye]
[Choice: Get a small heart near your temple]
[Choice: Get a lightning bolt across your cheek]

choices.text: Decide not to get your face painted
Get a small star on your cheek
Get a tiny flower on your forehead
Get a tribal symbol under your eye
Get a small heart near your temple
Get a lightning bolt across your cheek

passages.name: Day 5 - 17
passages.text:
"I think I'll pass for today," you say, shaking your head. "I don't really want to get my face painted."

 "Boring!" Samantha rolls her eyes.

 "What a shame," Luke sighs.

 
 
 
 "I want a simple star on my cheek, just below my eye," you say, taking a seat at the table. It's a subtle design, but it has a fun vibe that fits the party well.

 "Oh, that's a good one," Rachel says, picking up a brush and dipping it in silver paint. She quickly paints a star on your cheek, adding a white outline and a hint of sparkle. "Perfect, it looks great on you."

 "Pretty classic design, good one," Samantha compliments, nodding her head.

 "Yup, it looks nice," Luke pats your back.

 
 
 
 
 "I want a flower on my forehead," you say, taking a seat at the table. It's a delicate bloom that would sit somewhere visible, and you think it would look nice.

 "Good choice!" Rachel says, smiling. She picks up a brush and delicately paints a small, pink-and-white flower on your forehead. "It's subtle but adds a nice touch to your face."

 "Little girly, but it looks cute," Samantha compliments, nodding her head.

 "Good choice," Luke pats your back.

 
 
 
 
 "I want a tribal symbol under my eye," you say, taking a seat and pointing to an intricate tribal design. It's a few sharp angular lines, and it looks bold and cool.

 "Nice!" Rachel says, painting the lines for you. You check it out in the mirror and it adds a slightly more rebellious edge to your look. "That's a bit edgier, but definitely unique."

 "Ooh, cool design," Samantha compliments, nodding her head.

 "Yeah, it really makes you look like someone that shouldn't be messed with," Luke pats your back.

 
 
 
 
 "I want a small heart near my temple, something simple," you say, taking a seat at the table. A heart fit with just about anything, so you thought it would be a good choice.

 "Sure, let me draw it on you," Rachel picks up her brush and quickly paints a tiny, red heart on your face. "That one's cute! It suits you."

 "Did you want to show that off to your crush, [name]?" Samantha giggles.

 "Who knows, maybe he's just showing off his romantic side," Luke shrugs.

 
 
 
 "I'll take the lighting bolt," you say, sitting down and pointing to the jagged design. "Something with a bit more edge."

 "Love it," Rachel says, flicking her wrist to draw the yellow lightning bolt on your cheek. "That one's got energy."

 "Cool, you look badass," Samantha giggles.

 "Talk about making a statement," Luke whistles in appreciation.
 

"Well, thanks for checking out the face paint station!" Rachel says with a genuine smile on her face. "I hope you all are satisfied with what you got."

"Oh yeah, thanks Rach," Samantha replies.

The three of you spend the rest of the time hanging out and fooling around, along with participating in some of the smaller activities. Time passes, and eventually, the night starts to wind down. As you, Luke, and Samantha are sipping on punch at the back of the gym, the lights suddenly dim. The upbeat music fades into a slower, more romantic tune. The gym looks almost magical with the soft lighting and music, the balloons and confetti littering the floor. The speakers crackle with static before a voice comes out.

"Alright, everyone," the DJ, who's actually just a teacher, announces. "It's time to cap off the night with our last dance. Find a partner, someone you'd like to share this moment with and let's make it a night to remember!"

You watch as couples begin to take the floor, your heart starting to beat a little faster as you contemplate what you should do. You look from Samantha to your left and Luke to your right, your eyes jumping from one to the other, before you finally make a decision.

[Choice: Sit out the dance]
[Choice: Dance with Samantha]
[Choice: Dance with Luke]

passages.name: Day 5 - 18
passages.text:
The night winds down, and the lights in the gym begin to dim. This signals the end of the back-to-school party, and everyone knows it. Students start to gather their belongings, lingering in small groups. The principal takes the microphone once more to address the crowd.

"Alright, everyone!" he says, a wide smile plastered on his face. "I hope you had a fantastic time tonight! Let's give a big hand to the student council and everyone who helped put this amazing party together!"

A round of applause erupts across the gym, with a few cheers from students. 

"Before you head out, I just want to give you all a quick reminder," the principal says. "Let's keep things respectful as you head home, and get some rest. We've got a big year ahead of us, and I know you're all going to make it one to remember! Have a safe night."

Students begin to filter out of the gym. Some are still buzzing with energy while others are ready to get into bed and sleep after hours of dancing and socializing. You find yourself standing with Luke and Samantha near the gym's entrance, the three of you basking in the afterglow of a night well spent.

"I feel like we just got started, and it's over already?" Samantha asks.

"I don't know, I'm dead tired," Luke stretches. "I'm ready to crash."

"But it was fun, right?" you smile. "Totally worth it." 

As the three of you reach the parking lot, you all say your goodbyes and split off. You can still hear the distant echoes of laughter and chatter as you walk home.

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 5 - 19
passages.text:
You get back home and collapse on your bed, burying your face in the pillow. 

 "How was the party?" Lily opens your door and asks. "Wait, let me guess! You were so unpopular that everyone called you a loser and laughed at you."

 "Projecting much?" you groan.

 "Geez, you must be really tired," Lily says, her voice taking on a softer tone. "You're not as mean as usual."

 "Too tired."

 "Well, I'll leave you be," Lily turns off the light for you and exits your room. You instantly fall asleep, ready for the weekend.

 
 
 
 Skip Back to School Party Achievement Unlocked! 
 
 
 You spend the next few hours doing nothing, just wasting time as you didn't go to the party. Your sister comes into the room and makes fun of you a few times, calling you a loser. Normal sibling banter. You get a few texts from Samantha and Luke, and they seem disappointed you didn't attend. You try and ignore the nagging feeling that you should've attended the party as you drift off to sleep. Maybe you missed a lot of cool stuff that could've happened.
 

[Choice: It's time for the weekend]

passages.name: Day 5 - 2
passages.text:
You take a seat at your usual lunch table, where Samantha and Luke already are. You were unlucky and ended up in the back of the lunch line, so it took you a while to finally get your food.

"Hey, [name]!" Samantha chirps, excited to see you. "Do you know what you're going to wear to the back-to-school party? I already have everything decided, I'm super excited!"

"Yeah, we know Samantha, you dragged us to the mall yesterday," Luke comments.

"Shut up, you should enjoy spending quality time with your two besties," Samantha retorts. "Anyway, [name], are you ready for the party today? I asked you that before Puke so rudely interrupted us."

[Choice: Downplay the party and focus on other things]
[Choice: Show excitement and ask about the party]

choices.text: Downplay the party and focus on other things
Show excitement and ask about the party

passages.name: Day 5 - 3
passages.text:
"Who cares about the party?" you scoff, trying to take attention off the party. "Anyway, what do you guys have planned for the weekend?"

 "Bruh, stop trying to change the topic," Samantha says, rolling her eyes. "You'd better attend."

 
 
 "Yeah, I'm super excited for the party!" you say, smiling widely. "You know, I've met some cool people the last few days. Maybe I can talk to Jessica or Vincent."

 "Wait, when did you get to know Jessica?" Samantha asks. "Vincent is in the same ballpark of popularity as us, but Jessica?"
 

As you're about to respond, a guy walks up to your lunch table. You don't know his name, but you know he's one of the preppier, more popular kids. 

<<if [popularity] > 39>> 
 "Hey, [name], we would really like if you came to the party today!" he says, a smile on his face. "We need as many people as possible to come to the party today."

 "Oh, I'm thinking about it right now with my friends," you say, gesturing toward Samantha and Luke. "I'll try and come."

 "Great, thanks," he gives you a friendly nod and walks away.

 "Damn, at least he was nice about it," Luke says. "I doubt he would've been as kind if you weren't as popular."

 
 "Hey, [name], come to the party today, okay?" he demands. "We need everyone to come to the party today."

 "Oh, I'm thinking about it right now with my friends," you say, gesturing toward Samantha and Luke. "I'll decide on whether I'll go or not later."

 "Look, unless you have an emergency, try and come," he says, sighing and walking away.

 "Damn, I guess this is how they treat you if you're not popular," Luke says, laughing at the interaction that just went down.
 

[Choice: Finish up school]

passages.name: Day 5 - 4
passages.text:
You finish up school for the day and return home, putting your backpack on the floor and taking a seat at your desk. The party was at 5, so you had a while to prepare for it. But the question came as to whether you would actually attend the party or not. Going to the party would be fun, and you would be able to have a lot of cool interactions. Not going to the party would just let you relax for a few hours though, as you had nothing else to do in that time.

 
 Going to the party is highly recommended. There is no alternative content if you decide not to go to the party, and it'll hurt your popularity significantly. Not going to the party has no benefits whatsoever.
 

[Choice: Go to the party]
[Choice: Don't go to the party]

passages.name: Day 5 - 5
passages.text:
Back to School Party Achievement Unlocked! 
 
 
You sigh and decide you should go to the party. You text your friends that you're going to go to the party, much to their excitement. After doing some homework to pass the time, you look at the time and realize you need to get ready for the party. You look at the closet and decide on what to wear for your top. You have your usual T-shirt that you just wear every day, but you could decide to spice things up with a flannel jacket.

[Choice: Your usual T-shirt]
[Choice: A T-shirt with a flannel jacket over it]

choices.text: A T-shirt with a flannel jacket over it

passages.name: Day 5 - 6
passages.text:
You decide to go with your usual T-shirt, thinking that there's no reason to spice things up. If you wore that T-shirt every day, it would be fine for the party. 

 
 You decide to wear the flannel jacket on top of your usual T-shirt, deciding it wouldn't hurt to appear a little cooler. 
 
You look down at your usual shorts, wondering if there was a need to change that as well.

You will only have an option for this if you bought the skinny jeans at the mall yesterday. 

[Choice: Just wear your usual shorts]
 
 [Choice: Wear the skinny jeans you bought yesterday]

choices.text: Wear the skinny jeans you bought yesterday

passages.name: Day 5 - 7
passages.text:
You keep your usual shorts on. After all, if it's good enough for school, it should be good enough for the party. 

 
 You take off your shorts and wear the skinny jeans you bought yesterday. They fit you really well and make you look better than you did before. 
 
You nod at your reflection in the mirror, satisfied with your outfit of choice. You quickly stretch and make your way downstairs, ready to leave and go to the party.

"Going to the party?" Lily questions, stretched out on the couch. "I'm going to go too once I'm in high school."

"Yeah, thank the heavens I'll be out of high school by then," you say, cringing at the thought of being in the same high school as Lily. 

 
 "Wait, show me your ears real quick!" Lily says, scrambling up and walking over to you. "Did you get them pierced?"

 "So, what if I did?" you ask.

 "That's so cool!" Lily pumps her first out of excitement. "If you keep this up, you might not be such a loser!"

 <<if [popularity] > 39>> 
 "I'm not that unpopular," you argue. 

 "Whatever you say, dude," Lily rolls her eyes. "Anyway, don't embarrass yourself too much at the party. I'll be going to Pacific Crest too next year, so I don't want people thinking my older brother is some weirdo."

 "I'll try just for you, Lily," you chuckle.
 
 
 "Damn, way to hurt me," you say, since you weren't that popular. 

 "I'm just telling the truth," Lily rolls her eyes. "Anyway, don't embarrass yourself too much at the party. I'll be going to Pacific Crest too next year, so I don't want people thinking my older brother is some weirdo."

 "I'll try just for you, Lily," you chuckle.
 

 
 "Anyway, don't embarrass yourself too much at the party," Lily sighs. "I'll be going to the same high school next year, so I don't want people thinking my older brother is some weirdo."

 "I'll try just for you, Lily," you chuckle.
 

You step out of the house, ready to go to the party.

[Choice: Go to the party]

passages.name: Day 5 - 8
passages.text:
You enter the school gym, looking around at the decorations. The theme for this year's senior back-to-school party was Under the Sea, something that was very evident by the fish hanging from the ceiling. This party marks the official kick-off to senior year, and you're determined to use this time well. Colorful spotlights cast lights across the floor, and a DJ is on one end of the gym, blasting some of the latest pop music. There's a photo booth in the corner and a table with refreshments. The party hasn't officially started yet, so everyone's just mingling and chatting.

"[name], you decided to come!" Samantha says, excitedly running up to you. "I'll be honest, I was a little worried you wouldn't show up."

"Of course I'd show up," you say, deciding not to tell her you made the decision to come to the party a few minutes ago. "Where's Luke at?"

"Oh, he's forced to hang out with the football team," she shakes her head. "It's a shame, but we'll manage to steal him back. Anyway, what do you think of how I look?"

 
 Samantha is looking stunningly sexy in her red dress and heels. Her makeup matches as well, with a smoky red look that makes her look out of this world. 

 
 Samantha is looking really cute in her floral dress and sandals. Her makeup matches as well, with a simple cute style that makes her look adorable. 

 
 Samantha is looking classy and hot in her little black dress and flats. Her makeup matches as well, with an alluring style that makes her look difficult to approach in a good way.
 

"You look really good, I think I helped make the right decision," you offer a kind smile.

"Thanks, it took me a while to decide on the makeup and shoes and everything, so I'm glad you like it," Samantha flats out her dress. 
 
 
 "You know, I'm glad you wore those skinny jeans, they look nice and are sure to boost your popularity."
 

The sound of microphone feedback fills the room for a second, making everyone wince and cover their ears. 

"Sorry about that, everyone," you hear the principal say, standing on the stage. "But I wanted to welcome everyone to the 2024 back-to-school party! I hope you're all as excited as I am to kick off this year on a high note. Senior year is a time of growth, friendship, and hard work, but tonight we're putting all that aside to celebrate you—the students who make this school special. Enjoy the night and make some memories with your friend that'll last a lifetime. Without further ado, let's get this night started!"

A loud cheer erupts from the crowd, everyone excited that the night is finally getting started. 

"So, how does this all work again?" you ask, not having a clue about how the party will go.

"Well, we have some time for activities," Samantha thinks, rubbing her chin. "Here, let's go do some karaoke."

[Choice: Go to the karaoke booth]

passages.name: Day 5 - 9
passages.text:
You head over to the makeshift karaoke booth, complete with some cheap microphones, crappy speakers, and a screen with song lyrics. Some people already beat you to it, and you can see a girl singing. Some of her friends are playing with tambourines and cheering her on.

"Hmm, what should I sing after she finishes?" Samantha asks herself, opening her phone to browse her playlist. "Ooh, should I go for a classic or trending song?"

[Choice: The classic song]
[Choice: The trending song]

passages.name: Day 5 - Karaoke
passages.text:
"You know what, sure, I can sing," you say, grabbing the microphone and walking up to the karaoke booth. The people around you cheer, excited to hear a song. You think about what you should sing, and finally start typing the name of the song on the karaoke machine's remote.

[Choice: Sing September]
[Choice: Sing Take on Me]
[Choice: Sing Toxic]
[Choice: Sing Skibidi Toilet]

passages.name: Day 5 - Karaoke 1
passages.text:
You type in September and the song's funky groove starts playing. You grab the microphone and do the signature silly dance moves as you begin singing. You do a pretty good job, if you do say so yourself, and the song fits the current month and vibe perfectly. The crowd is pleased, and you finish to a loud round of applause.

 "Enjoy this September!" you yell out as you hand off the microphone and remote.

 "Damn, that song choice was honestly on point," Samantha says as she approaches you. "September in September, what could possibly be a better fit?"

 "Do you remember the 21st night of September?" you ask, laughing. 

 
 You type in Take on Me and press play, letting the synth-pop song's iconic intro start playing. You sing the best you can, and do a pretty good job, if you do say so yourself. You're able to nail the high notes, being very glad that your voice didn't crack. The crowd claps along to the song, and you finish to a round of applause.

 "Thanks for the support!" you say, feeling good after the performance you just put on. 

 "Aww, I actually have a soft spot for that song, good job," Samantha says as she approaches you. "I was a little worried you'd mess up the high notes but you did good!"

 "Yeah, the song is one of my favorites," you enthused, sporting a wide grin on your face.

 
 You find Britney Spear's classic song on the machine and the crowd cheers as the song's instantly recognizable intro plays. You sway to the beat and start singing, doing a pretty good job. At one point in the song, you move your hips alluringly just as a joke, and everyone whoops and hollers. Everyone likes your performance, and as the song winds down, everyone claps for you.

 "Thanks!" you yell out as you put down the microphone.

 "Damn, that move with your hips was a little zesty," Samantha snickers as she approaches you. "But good job, you did really well!"

 "I've got to do anything I can to please the crowd," you say with a smirk on your face.

 
 
 You type in Skibidi Toilet, and to your surprise, Generation Alpha's anthem is right there. You click on it and tap your foot to the rhythm as the song gets started. Everyone cheers, recognizing the song from social media, and you begin to sing. You do a pretty good job, if you do say so yourself, considering how bad the song is. Nevertheless, it is a crowd-pleaser, and you finish to a loud round of applause.

 "Thank you, everyone!" you say, taking a deep bow as if you just had the performance of a lifetime. You hand off the microphone and remote to the next person who wants to sing and walk away from the booth.

 "Damn, I can't believe you chose that song," Samantha laughs as she approaches you. "What are you, a baby?"

 "Hey, it made everyone happy, didn't it?" you laugh along at the ridiculousness.
 

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 5 - Luke
passages.text:
"Come on, dude," Luke chuckles, playfully nudging you as he notices you staring at him. "Let's show everyone how it's done."

You can't even get a word out before Luke grabs your arm with just the right amount of strength. His grip is strong but not overwhelming, and you can feel the warmth radiating off of him. There's a nervous energy between you two, as you are both guys, but there's no denying the connection you two have. Luke, always confident, starts doing some silly dance moves. You laugh, watching him spin around and move his arms. It's clear he's not taking things too seriously.

[Choice: Keep it casual]
[Choice: Dance a bit closer]
[Choice: Get competitive]
[Choice: Feel nervous]

passages.name: Day 5 - Luke 1
passages.text:
You decide to keep things chill and do your best to match Luke's playful energy. You mimic his goofy dance moves, throwing in a crazy breakdancing move just for fun. There's honestly something comforting about how carefree your best friend is, so you roll with it. 

 "There we go, [name]," Luke says with a wide grin on his face. "Good job, we're seriously going to be legends after this."

 "Yeah, we are!" you reply. You look around to see some amused glances from your peers, but that just makes you laugh harder. Your worries about how people might see you fade as you lose yourself in the moment.

 "Now presenting the kings of the dance floor!" Luke says in an exaggerated tone, trying to imitate a narrator. He swings into a dramatic spin and stops in a weird pose, gesturing for you to follow suit. You try to do the same, but end up clumsily stumbling a little. You continue the playful back-and-forth, as the both of you build on the other's jokes. The dance moves get sillier and sillier until what you're doing is almost unrecognizable as a dance move. 

 "Damn, we're the best!" you yell, the both of you radiating carefree energy. You attempt a dramatic dance move, but end up bumping into Luke.

 "Woah, careful!" Luke says, stumbling a little. "Let's not get injured today."

 You straighten yourself up, shaking your head at how ridiculous the whole thing has become. But the energy you and Luke have been giving off seems to be contagious, as other students begin joining in with some weird moves as well. By the time the song ends, the two of you are breathless from laughing so much. You feel lighter than you have in a while, and a smile is plastered on your face.

 "What did I say, huh?" Luke says. "I told you we'd be legends."

 "Legends of bad dancing, sure," you say. 

 The two of you laugh as you leave the dance floor, having stolen the spotlight for a few minutes. As you walk away, some of your peers give you approving nods and high-fives, and you feel elated.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As the music shifts into a slower, more intimate rhythm, you can't help but hesitate for a moment. You glance at Luke, who looks a bit awkward but smiles encouragingly. The atmosphere in the gym has shifted, the lights dimming slightly as couples around you begin to sway to the softer tune. You take a breath, deciding to close the distance between you and Luke. You step closer, your bodies now just a few inches apart. The proximity feels different, but not bad. Luke's eyes widen a little, but he doesn't pull away from you. There's just a quiet understanding between the two of you, an unspoken agreement to just go with the flow.

 "Guess this is what we're doing now, huh?" you chuckle nervously.

 "Hey, you're the one who wanted to dance closer," Luke replies.

 The music wraps around you, and for a moment, the world outside the two of you fades away. You feel the warmth radiating between you and Luke, and although it's a new feeling, it's one that's oddly comforting. You've known Luke for ages now, and there's something grounding about being here with him. As you sway to the rhythm, your movements are slower and more in sync with the mood of the song. Luke's hands rest on your shoulders, and you place your own hands around his waist. It's still a bit awkward, but you make it work. 

 "Careful, [name]," Luke teases. "I use my body for ramming into people, not dancing, so I might not be the best at dancing."

 "I'm not the best at dancing either," you laugh. "Guess we're a disaster waiting to happen."

 The awkwardness starts to disappear and everything starts to feel quite natural. It fully dissolves, and what remains is a sense of calm. You can feel the subtle rise and fall of his breath, his broad chest against yours, and the two of you just dance. You're fully engrossed in the moment, and right now, the only person in the world that matters is Luke.

 "You know, this isn't as bad as I thought it'd be," Luke says.

 "It's really not," you whisper back.

 The song draws to a close, and the final notes of the melody hang in the air as you glance at Luke, who's grinning widely. Your eyes meet for a second, your brown eyes meeting his gray ones. You quickly glance away, your heart pounding and cheeks flushing. What was this feeling? You'd been friends with Luke for so long but you never felt this way around him before. 

 "Not bad for two guys who can't dance," Luke chuckles. "If you think about it, we weren't a disaster waiting to happen."

 "We r-really weren't," you stumble over your words a little. 

 You step apart as the song ends, and you feel breathless. Not from the dancing, but from the comforting experience of it all. The two of you exchange a brief but meaningful look before Luke gives you a friendly clap on the shoulder. The two of you walk off the dance floor, feeling very different than when you first stepped on it together. And although you hate to admit it, you wouldn't have minded having Luke's hands on your shoulders a little longer.

 
 
 
 
 As the song plays, you exchange a brief glance with Luke. Something familiar sparks, a sense of competition flickering between the two of you.

 "You're not going to let me show you up here, are you?" Luke asks, a hint of a challenge in his voice.

 "Only if you can keep up," you reply.

 Without missing a beat, Luke takes your hand, and you both step up your game. You begin mirroring each other's moves, each trying to outdo the other. Luke spins you around, but instead of stumbling, you spin right back.

 "Damn, not bad," Luke says. "But watch this."

 Luke throws in an exaggerated twirl, pulling you back with a wide grin. You respond with your own quick footwork, stepping up the tempo. The two of you move in sync, but there's a clear edge of competition in each step and move, as both of you are unwilling to back down. 

 "Go, [name]!" Samantha cheers for you. "Don't let Luke win."

 You shoot her a quick smirk before refocusing on Luke. You playfully push him, nudging his shoulder lightly. Your laughter fills the air as you try to one-up him, and it's clear you're both having a blast. As the song reaches its climax, Luke pulls off a smooth move, dipping you unexpectedly. You're surprised, but unwilling to lose. You quickly recover, pushing yourself back up and spinning away in a flourish.

 "Not bad, [name]," Luke chuckles. 

 "Come on, I clearly won that," you quip back.

 You both share a light-hearted laugh, feeling tired but exhilarated from the competition. The two of you exit the dance floor, and although neither of you will admit it, it is a tie.

 
 
 
 As the music plays and you sway awkwardly with Luke, an unexpected wave of self-consciousness washes over you. You become acutely aware of everything—the curious glances from your peers, the slight stiffness in Luke's movements, and the fact that you're a guy dancing with another guy. You can't shake the feeling that people are watching. Your thoughts begin to race, filled with uncertainty and doubt. 

 "Hey, are you good?" Luke asks, concerned after noticing the change in your body language.

 "Yeah, but it just feels kind of weird, doesn't it?" you try to force a chuckle but can't.

 "Not at all," Luke raises his eyebrows. "It's just a dance, who cares what other people think."

 You appreciate the nonchalance he has, but it doesn't stop your heart from pounding. You try to focus on the music, but the sensation of being out of place lingers. You notice how stiffly you're moving compared to some of the other pairs. There's no fluidity to your steps, no rhythm in your movements. 

 "I don't know," you say, your voice trailing off.

 "We can just step this one out if you're not feeling it," Luke says, gently putting a hand on your shoulder. The two of you make your way off the dance floor early, a bit of awkwardness lingering.
 

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 5 - Samantha
passages.text:
"So, are you gonna ask me, or do I have to do all the work?" Samantha notices you staring at her and extends her hand dramatically, her eyes glinting with mischief.

You can't help but laugh at her confidence, as Samantha's always been the one to take the lead when you hesitated. There's a beat before you take her hand, and you make your way onto the dance floor. The slow rhythm of the music sets the tone as you face each other. As the two of you begin to sway, Samantha keeps things light and playful. She starts humming along to the music, occasionally doing a dance move.

[Choice: Take the lead]
[Choice: Let Samantha take the lead]
[Choice: Dance closer]
[Choice: Keep things light]

passages.name: Day 5 - Samantha 1
passages.text:
You take a deep breath, feeling the pulse of the music in the gym. You turn to Samantha, who's watching you with an expectant grin and a subtle challenge in her eyes. Samantha's always teased you about your hesitance and lack of confidence, but you decide to surprise her tonight.

 "Alright, let's see if you can keep up," you say.

 "Oh?" Samantha asks, her eyebrows shooting up. "Mr. Yoon finally has some moves?"

 Without another word, you hold out your hand. Samantha grasps it, her soft hand clasped in yours. You lead her onto the dance floor, gently pulling her close as the two of you find your rhythm. You guide the movements, making Samantha grin. 

 "Look at you, all in control."

 You spin her with a flourish, your steps steady. You're surprised by yourself, you're not normally the type to take charge, especially on the dance floor. But something about this moment just feels right, like you have a perfect opportunity. Your nerves settle and you lean into the flow of the music, allowing your body to move naturally. You know you're in control, and there's a sense of fluidity in how you're leading.

 "Hmm, maybe I've been holding back too much," you chuckle.

 "Maybe you have!" Samantha laughs, clearly impressed. "Where's all this confidence coming from?"

 Your bodies briefly brush as you dance, and your heart races. Not from nerves, but from the excitement of the moment. Right now, you're just having fun and enjoying the moment with Samantha. As the song reaches its final notes, you dip Samantha, causing her to giggle in delight. You hold the position for a second before she pushes herself back upright, and you can see just a hint of rose on her cheeks. For a few minutes, this dance made you feel like you were in your own little world.

 "You seriously pulled that off, huh?" Samantha asks.

 "Maybe you've been underestimating me," you reply. 

 The two of you make your way off the dance floor, but despite the crowd around you, you don't see anybody other than Samantha.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The music pulses softly, and as everyone begins to settle into pairs, Samantha flashes a grin at you.

 "How about I lead this time?" she asks.

 "You know what, sure," you reply. You're not confident about your own dancing skills in the slightest, and Samantha's leading would take some of the pressure off you. "You're probably better at this anyway."

 Samantha steps in closer, taking charge with supreme confidence. She places her hand firmly on your waist and leads you into the rhythm of the song. Her movements are smooth and assertive, guiding you with a gentle tug here and a subtle nudge there. You stumble slightly at first, but Samantha keeps you steady. As she moves with you across the floor, gliding through the dance, she spins you around lightly. You can't help but laugh at how strange it feels to be led like this, but there's a strange and oddly enjoyable sensation in giving up control.

 "I'm amazing, no?" Samantha winks, and you can feel a little bit of tension leave your body. You remind yourself that Samantha is your best friend, and seeing her be her usual playful self helps you relax. 

 "You are amazing, Samantha," you laugh.

 As the dance progresses, Samantha continues to guide you through the music, occasionally adding a fancy move. You notice some of your peers around you, but you can't be bothered to care what they think. You're too focused on keeping up with Samantha's pace and enjoying the moment. Suddenly, Samantha pulls you closer, her voice dropping to a serious tone for just a second.

 "You're doing really well, [name]," she says. "Sometimes, you just have to let go of everything and live in the moment."

 You nod, unable to say anything. Her message resonates with you though, and you realize letting go isn't a bad thing. Maybe, just maybe, with everything going on, it would be okay to let someone else take control for a change. The music slows as the song nears its end, and Samantha is clearly pleased with the performance the two of you put on.

 "Samantha, that was amazing," you say, exhilarated by the dance you shared with her.

 "Sounds like a win to me," Samantha says. The both of you stand there for a moment, both a little breathless from the fun of it all. You realize that despite your initial hesitation, you feel lighter. As the two of you head off the dance floor, there's a sense of ease in your body that wasn't there before.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As the song takes on a softer, slower rhythm, you lock eyes with Samantha. There's a playful gleam in her gaze, the one she always has, but this time you feel something more intimate buried deep inside. You hesitate for just a moment, but the music, the way she smiles, and her green eyes urge you to step a little closer. You tighten your hold on her hand and draw her in, feeling the warmth of her body as you bridge the space between you and her. Samantha doesn't pull away though, instead letting out an amused breath. She wraps her free arm around your shoulder, resting her hand comfortably.

 "Getting bold, huh?" she giggles. 

 "Who knows, maybe I am getting bold," you reply.

 The tension in your shoulders slowly eases as you settle into the rhythm of the music. The close proximity between you two makes the dance feel more intimate, and you feel hyperaware of everything. The brush of her arm, the way your hands stay linked, and the way her dark hair falls softly against your cheek. Samantha's expression softens as you move, the teasing tone she always has fading into something more sincere.

 "You're not bad at this, [name]," she whispers. "Maybe you've got more rhythm than you let on."

 You feel your cheeks flush slightly, caught off guard by the compliment. Not quite knowing how to respond, you give her a small smile.

 "Maybe I've been holding out on you."

 You fall into a comfortable silence, the music and your gaze saying everything that needs to be said. You feel the closeness in every step, and it's different from how the two of you usually interact. Not in a bad way though. You let your thoughts drift, wondering how things might be changing between the two of you. There's something unspoken in the air, a quiet tension buzzing.

 "This is kind of nice, don't you think?"

 "Yeah, it is."

 The two of you continue dancing, moving a little slower now, more in tune with each other. It's not as playful as before, but there's a sense of comfort in the closeness. As the song winds down, Samantha looks up at you with a small, knowing smile. When the music finally stops, she pulls back just slightly, but her hand lingers on your shoulder for a moment before she finally lets go. She doesn't say anything out loud, but you can sense there are unspoken words. The two of you leave the dance floor, feeling very different.

 
 As the music sways through the gym, you feel a mix of excitement and nerves. Dancing with Samantha feels comfortable in some ways but it is definitely unfamiliar. You know Samantha well enough to know she'd probably lead the two of you into something wild or playful if you let her, but you just want to keep things simple tonight. You fall into step with the beat, and you choose not to take the lead or do anything bold. You just let the moment flow, keeping the dance easy and light.

 "Aww, come on, [name]," Samantha says with a playful smile on her face. "I know you can do better than this."

 "What, are you saying my moves aren't good enough for you?" you reply.

 "I'm saying you've got potential that you're holding back on," she teases.

 The two of you continue bantering, the lighthearted teasing making the dance feel like just another fun moment between friends. Samantha occasionally adds some small flourish to her movements, but you keep things simple. You're just going to enjoy the moment without pushing it. The both of you laugh, the conversation flowing easily as you sway side by side. The comfortable rhythm helps you forget about the crowd, and for a few minutes, it's just the two of you. Best friends enjoying each other's company. As you make your way off the dance floor with her, you're glad that Samantha is your best friend.
 

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 6 - 1
passages.text:
"Dude, get up!" you hear your sister's voice say as you're shaken awake. 

"Huh?" you ask groggily, still half-asleep. "What's up?"

"Well, Mom and Dad want to have a family breakfast," Lily says. "They told me to wake you up."

"How cruel of them," you muse. "Waking up to your face and voice is horrific."

"Shut up," Lily shoves you in annoyance. "Anyway, get to the dining room soon."

Lily leaves and you push yourself off your bed and onto the floor. You look in the mirror, wondering how you're going to explain the way you look. You look 
<<if [feminineLooks] > 19>> 
 very different from how you did when this week started.
<<elseif [feminineLooks] > 9>> 
 a little different from how you did when this week started.

 
 not too different from how you did when this week started.
 

[Choice: Go to the dining room]

passages.name: Day 6 - 2
passages.text:
"Morning, [name]," your mom says, noticing how tired you look. "Did the back-to-school party have you exhausted?"

 "You didn't get into too much trouble at that party last night, did you?" your dad asks. 

 "I didn't get into any trouble, Dad," you say. "But it was really tiring."

 
 "Go shower after you eat, you still have face paint on," your mom says.

 "Yes, yes," you reply. It slipped your mind, but you completely forgot to shower yesterday.
 

 
 "Morning, [name]," your mom says. "Wake up a little earlier next time, you didn't even go to the back-to-school party."

 "Sorry, Mom," you reply, rubbing your eyes.
 

<<if [feminineLooks] > 19>> 
 "You know, you look a little different, [name]," your dad says, inspecting your face closely. "Softer, I think."

 "Yeah, he said he's experimenting with how he looks or something," Lily explains.

 "Ah, I see," your dad replies, his face unreadable.

 
 Your dad glances at your face for a second but then looks away, not noticing anything.
 

"So, what are we having for breakfast?" Lily asks, sniffing the air. "I smell sausage."

"You smell the sausage but can't smell your own body odor?" you ask, chuckling. Lily didn't have any body odor, but it was fun teasing her. "Geez, we might have to get you to a doctor."

"I do not have any body odor, did you even shower yesterday?" Lily asks indignantly.

"Okay, next topic," you cough awkwardly, realizing she caught you.

"No, no, you didn't shower and you're calling me stinky?" she says with a sly smile on her face. "According to my big brain, this is hypocrisy at its finest!"

"Knock it off, you two," your mom says, bringing plates full of various classic American breakfast foods to the table. "Just enjoy the food, okay?"

"Yay, I knew I smelled sausage!" Lily exclaims as she sees a plate of sausage. "See, [name]."

"Yeah, yeah," you reply. Your entire family starts digging into the breakfast, enjoying the food.

"So, how's the senior year going so far?" your dad asks after he finishes chewing and swallowing the bite he was eating. He seems a little awkward, with a forced smile plastered on his face, but it's clear he's genuinely putting in effort. "Did anything exciting happen? Do you have any plans for the weekend?"

"[name]'s just going to mope around like he always does," Lily teases you. "That's your plan this weekend, isn't it?"

You think about how you should respond.

 
 How you treat your father will have a massive impact on how his arc goes. Will your dad become your greatest ally or will he remain the distant father he's always been?
 

[Choice: Open up and engage with your dad]
[Choice: Keep things vague, don't open up to your dad]
[Choice: Deflect to Lily, shift the focus off yourself]
[Choice: Reject the conversation]

choices.text: Open up and engage with your dad
Keep things vague, don't open up to your dad
Deflect to Lily, shift the focus off yourself

passages.name: Day 6 - 3
passages.text:
"Oh, a lot has been going on," you say, thinking about all that has happened in just a week. You leave out the curse but talk about some other stuff that's happened. 
 
 "I went to the back-to-school party the other night, and it was actually fun. I also signed up for a club and went to the mall."
 
 
 "I signed up for a club and went to the mall. The back-to-school party was the other night, but I didn't attend."
 

 "Looks like you've got a lot going on!" your dad says enthusiastically. "What club did you sign up for?"

 
 "The Academic Club," you respond, swallowing a bite of your eggs. "I just thought it'd be good to go for something related to studying since colleges like it."
 
 
 "The Occult Club," you respond, swallowing a bite of your eggs. "I know it's unconventional, but I think the unexplained is super interesting."
 
 
 "The Fashion Club," you respond, swallowing a bite of your eggs. "I didn't expect myself to join the fashion club, but the opportunities it provides are actually really cool."
 
 
 "The Yearbook Club," you respond, swallowing a bite of your eggs. "I think it'll be a really good experience to make the yearbook in my senior year."
 

 "That's great to hear, [name]," your dad says, looking pleasantly surprised. "I hope you enjoy the club, trying new things is what this year should be about. I know I haven't been around as much as I should have, but I'd love to hear more about it. Maybe we can grab something to eat and spend some time together, just the two of us."

 Your dad's tone softens considerably, and it's clear he's genuinely making an effort to connect. This feels new to you, as until now, it seemed he was just going through the motions of being a father. You appreciate the attention, but another part of you feels a little unsure.

 "Wow, you're actually doing something exciting," Lily leans over her plate with a grin. "The mall and a school club, it's all so exciting. Who knows, maybe you'll become a social butterfly."

 "Yeah, don't expect anything," you roll your eyes. "Sorry that I'm not the super popular older brother that you wanted."

 "Listen, I know things have been different this year," your dad steps back in. "I just want to let you know I'm here if you ever want to talk about anything. School, friends, whatever's on your mind. It's not just about grades and college. I'm trying to do better for you two."

 
 "Oh well, same old, same old," you shrug and continue eating, not really wanting to have a serious conversation. The reply is almost automatic, the kind of response you've given so many times in the past. 

 "Same old, huh?" your dad frowns, a flicker of hurt in his eyes. It's clear he's disappointed by your response, but he does his best not to let it show too much. "I guess that's not necessarily a bad thing. At least you're not dealing with any drama, huh?"

 Silence fills the room as you remain focused on your breakfast, not giving much away. Your dad chuckles lightly, in his best attempt to lighten the mood, but it's clear the conversation has run out of steam already.

 <<if [feminineLooks] > 9>> 
 "I don't know about things being the same old for you, [name]," Lily interjects, filling the tense silence. "You never used to care about how you look, but you've been different lately. Who knows, things might be changing up for my loser brother."
 
 
 "Maybe things are the same old, you still look the same as always, [name]," Lily interjects, filling the tense silence. "My loser brother never changes, how sad."
 

 "Lily, don't call your brother a loser," your mom steps in, trying to smooth things over. Your dad's attempt at giving you attention ends there, and you wonder if you should've said anything differently.

 
 
 "Well, anything I say wouldn't be nearly as interesting as hearing about Lily's interesting life," you say with a sly grin, turning the spotlight toward your younger sister. It's a move you've mastered over the years, as it allows you to not talk about yourself while getting to tease Lily. You know she loves the attention anyway.

 "Come on, my life is so interesting compared to you, [name]," Lily perks up. "I can't believe nobody is interested in my amazing life."

 "Well, Lily's always got something going on," your dad says. "But I'm curious about how things are going for you, [name]. I know school can be a lot to handle sometimes, and I'm always here if you need to chat."

 An awkward silence fills the room as you don't respond to your dad. You just continue poking at your breakfast.

 "Well, since everyone's so curious, I'm doing fantastic, as usual," Lily boasts, giving you yet another opportunity to deflect the spotlight to Lily. The conversation shifts away from you, although your dad gives you a lingering stare of disappointment.

 
 
 "I don't really want to talk about it," you say, feeling a pang of frustration. The stress from the curse looming in the background, the pressure from the changes you've been experiencing, and the irritation from your dad's attempt to dig into your life all make your temper short. You turn back to your breakfast, intentionally focusing on cutting your toast.

 "Oh..." your dad says, taken aback. His face is a mix of surprise and disappointment, and he looks away from you while shifting uncomfortably. "Alright then."

 "You know, [name]'s always been a little independent," your mom steps in, picking up on the tension. "I think he just needs a little breathing room."

 After some more awkward silence passes, conversation resumes, although your dad is clearly trying to respect your space now. You're just glad you don't have to deal with it for now.
 

[Choice: Finish up breakfast]

passages.name: Day 6 - 4
passages.text:
You finish up breakfast, shoving the last of the eggs into your mouth. You dismiss yourself from the table and make your way back to your room. You think about what you should do this weekend, considering there's a ton you can do with your time. You look out your room's window to look at the city of Cedarbrook. It was home. You've lived here ever since you were a kid, but you haven't explored the city as much as you could have. You could spend the weekend doing that. 

You could also call Samantha and Luke, and get a hangout prepared. The local gym was always waiting for you to get a workout in. You could, of course, just do the lazy thing and stay at home. The final option was to try and somehow find Aurora after the mysterious thing she said to you in the hallway. There was a good chance she could know something.  

You can do three out of the five activities this Saturday. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
[Choice: Go explore the town]
[Choice: Go call Samantha and Luke]
[Choice: Go to the gym]
[Choice: Stay at home]
[Choice: Go and try to find Aurora]

choices.text: Go and try to find Aurora

passages.name: Day 6 - 5
passages.text:
After wrapping up your morning, you feel a sense of fulfillment. You find yourself back in your room in the afternoon, stretched out on your bed. You hug your favorite plushie, [plushieName] as you roll around the bed. The warmth of morning lingers on your mind as the sun begins to set, your room becoming darker and darker. You finish up some schoolwork and spend some time relaxing, considering you were busy the whole morning. Although you had two months of free time over the summer just a week ago, it's nice to have a day off after the hectic week you had. 

After a quick glance at the time, you realize you have a few hours left before you head off to bed. You rub your chin as you think about what you should do before you wrap up your Saturday. This is soon answered for you though, as Lily bursts into your room.

"What's up?" you ask.

"Looks like Mom and Dad want to have a movie night," Lily says, leaning on your doorframe. "Dad's really trying to get closer to us, I guess he feels bad."

"I'm not even in the mood for a movie," you groan, looking up at the ceiling. 

"Too bad, you have to come in five minutes, they even have the popcorn ready."

"Fine, give me a second," you say, sitting up in your bed.

[Choice: Make your way to the living room]

choices.text: Make your way to the living room

passages.name: Day 6 - 6
passages.text:
Everything is set up for the movie night, with popcorn on the table and everything you need for an entertaining time.

"Hey you two!" your dad says, bringing over a hot dog from the grill outside. "Come on, everything's ready!"

"This actually seems really nice," you murmur, pretty impressed.

"Sit down, we're watching The Princess Diaries," your mom brings over some nachos with a bunch of cheese.

"Who selected this movie?" Lily furrows her eyebrows.

"I did!" your dad says.

"Dad, do you think I'm still twelve?" Lily asks, seeming a little offended by your father's choice.

"O-Oh I'm sorry, I thought it would be a fun family movie to watch," your dad's face falls a little.

"It's fine," Lily responds.

You all get ready and your dad turns out the lights and makes his way over to the couch as the film starts. You've watched this movie before as a kid, but you don't quite remember much about it. It starts with this girl, Mia, who's this complete loser.

"Oh my god, it's you, [name]!" your sister says, giggling.

"Projecting much?" you quickly respond.

"You always say that," Lily pouts. "Be more creative."

The movie continues, and it turns out she's actually the sole heir to a small European kingdom, and that she will become a princess. She gets a makeover and goes from a frizzy-haired mess into a princess. You watch her transformation from an awkward high schooler into a posed, graceful princess. It's not just her physical appearance either, she learns a lot about herself as well. After the makeover, she looks in the mirror and sees herself changed. She's unsure of who she's become and is trying to figure out who she is now.

[Choice: You relate to her a lot]
[Choice: You don't really relate to her]

choices.text: You relate to her a lot
You don't really relate to her

passages.name: Day 6 - 7
passages.text:
<<if [acceptance] > 9>> 
 You can't help but feel a deep connection. You realize you're also learning who you are after your transformation and are starting to accept who you are now. 
 
 
 You can't help but feel a deep connection. You realize you're also learning who you are after your transformation and are unsure about your identity. 
 
 Your gaze lingers on Mia, a sense of understanding blooming inside you. You suddenly feel a strange chill running down your spine. You realize what'll happen, you're going to transform.

 "I have to go to the bathroom," you say, quickly excusing yourself. "Be right back."

 "Oh, do you want us to pause the movie for you?" your dad asks.

 "It's fine!" you yell, running to the bathroom.

 [Choice: Transform]

 
 You don't really relate to her, despite your curse.

 [Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 6 - 8
passages.text:
You finish up the movie, making sure to hide in the dark and make your way back to your room. You feel a little nauseous, having devoured hot dogs, nachos, and popcorn. 

 
 You finish up the movie, enjoying the experience, and make your way back to your room. You feel very full, having devoured hot dogs, nachos, and popcorn. 
 
You lie down on your bed and fall asleep, nervous about what Sunday has to hold.

[Choice: Continue]

passages.name: Day 6 - Bathroom
passages.text:
You look down, having just grown boobs. Boobs. On your body. You can't help but feel 
 <<if [transgender] > 4>> 
 happy for some reason. You don't know why, but you do feel a little happy.
 
 
 nervous.
 

 You think they're small enough that nobody will notice them for now, but you don't know what you'll do if they grow further. You decide to leave that for later though.

 
 You groan, you just transformed again. You think you can wave off the change though.
 

You look in the mirror and realize that 
<<if [femininity] > 19>> 
 at some point, your parents will comment on how much more feminine you look. You hope to avoid it this time around since the room is dark. But you're sure you'll have to talk about it at some point.

 
 you don't look feminine to the point where your parents will comment on it.
 

[Choice: Continue]

 [Choice: Go explore the town]
 
 
 [Choice: Go call Samantha and Luke]
 
 
 [Choice: Go to the gym]
 
 
 [Choice: Stay at home]
 
 
 [Choice: Go and try to find Aurora]
 
<<if [d6activities] > 2>>
